#id=1
#text=I prefer a shower over a bath , but when I need to take a bath it 's to relax from a stressful evening .
#id=2
#text=Taking a bath requires filling the whole tub up with warm water .
#id=3
#text=This may take some time and I will have to be sure to have a stopper to prevent the water from draining away from the tub .
#id=4
#text=While the water is filling up , I will add the bubble bath solution to make the water soapy and fragrant .
#id=5
#text=The aroma in the bath is what de-stresses me .
#id=6
#text=Usually it 'll be a nice lavender smell or something not too strong but is very pleasant to smell .
#id=7
#text=Once the tub is filled , I will slowly enter myself into the water .
#id=8
#text=This can be tough at first because the water is usually too hot in the beginning so I will ease myself in .
#id=9
#text=But once in , the bath will really work to help get the blood circulating to get a nice feeling of relaxation .
#text=I will typically stay in until the water is no longer warm or the bubbles have gone away .
#text=So when the water is just lukewarm , I will drain the tub and then rinse off using the normal shower .
